descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is a general survey of Russian Literature, focused on the interconnections between new ideas in culture and politics. Texts include great Modernist novels Peterburg (1913) by Andrei Bely, Master and Margarita (1940) by Mikhail Bulgakov, and Evgeny Zamiatin's We (1921); poetry by Aleksandr Blok, Vladimir Mayakovsky, Osip Mandelstam. These major literary works are discussed in the broad Russian and European cultural and historical context.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: The course will be conducted by a combination of lecture and discussion, and I expect students to be ready to answer questions in class. This means that it is imperative to read the assigned material before each lecture on it.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: There will be an in-class midterm exam (25%), final exam (25%), 3 in-class quizzes (30%), contributions to discussion, class attendance (20%).
